paper_abstract: Semi-supervised learning deals with learning with a small amount labeled sample and a large amount of unlabeled sample to improve the learning ability. The purpose of the semi-supervised gradient learning is to increase the smoothness of the solution using unlabeled gradient data. In this paper, we study the semi-supervised kernel-based regularization scheme involving function gradient value. We show that the learning rate can be bounded by a K-functional with gradients of the function, which verify how the unlabeled gradient data quantitatively influences the learning rate. Some approaches from convex analysis play a key role in our error analysis.
paper_title: Convergence rate of semi-supervised gradient learning algorithms
